title: Hellwege
text:
Hellwege is a municipality in the <a href="Rotenburg%20%28district%29">district of Rotenburg</a>, in <a href="Lower%20Saxony">Lower Saxony</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>.
Hellwege belonged to the <a href="Bishopric%20of%20Verden">Prince-Bishopric of Verden</a>, established in 1180. In 1648 the Prince-Bishopric was transformed into the <a href="Principality%20of%20Verden">Principality of Verden</a>, which was first ruled in <a href="personal%20union">personal union</a> by the Swedish Crown - interrupted by a Danish occupation (1712-1715) - and from 1715 on by the <a href="House%20of%20Hanover">Hanoverian</a> Crown. In 1807 the ephemeral<a href="Kingdom%20of%20Westphalia">Kingdom of Westphalia</a> annexed the Principality, before <a href="First%20French%20Empire">France</a> annexed it in 1810. In 1813 the Principality was restored to the <a href="Electorate%20of%20Hanover">Electorate of Hanover</a>, which - after its upgrade to the <a href="Kingdom%20of%20Hanover">Kingdom of Hanover</a> in 1814 - incorporated the Principality in a <a href="real%20union">real union</a> and the Princely territory, including Hellwege, became part of the new <a href="Stade%20%28region%29">Stade Region</a>, established in 1823. The name hellwege can also be used as a last name, and it is popular in Germany.
